snippet: The office parks along Interstate 287 once attracted Fortune 500 companies, then smaller companies. Now, some see the Platinum Mile’s future in a more diverse range of tenants.
abstract: Westchester County's so-called Platinum Mile, a once prosperous stretch of gleaming office parks just north of New York City, is struggling to find a new identity in a troubled economy; many see the area's future in a more diverse range of tenants.
lead_paragraph: The office parks along Interstate 287 once attracted Fortune 500 companies, then smaller companies. Now, some see the Platinum Mile’s future in a more diverse range of tenants.

headline.seo: Westchester County’s Platinum Mile Is Reinvented, Again
headline.main: In Westchester County, the Platinum Mile Is Reinvented, Again
headline.print_headline: In Westchester County, the Platinum Mile Is Reinvented, Again
